intro: Erinus incisus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved erinus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, sky-blue or white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Erinus incisus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its delicate appearance and ability to attract pollinators. It is relatively low maintenance and suitable for gardens with well-drained soil.
